sentences.en: "Have a nice Easter."— 'And the same to you Bridie.'
sentences.cn: “复活节快乐。”——“你也一样，布赖迪。”

sentences.en: By Easter, tourists were arriving in strength.
sentences.cn: 复活节到来时, 游客大批地涌来.

sentences.en: Easter eggs symbolize the renewal of life.
He only sees her at Christmas and Easter.
sentences.cn: 他只有在圣诞节和复活节时才能见到她。

sentences.en: In the end, we all decided to organize a concert for Easter.
sentences.cn: 最终，我们一致决定组织一场复活节音乐会。

sentences.en: Most villagers took communion only at Easter.
sentences.cn: 大部分村民只在复活节的时候领受圣餐。

sentences.en: She spends her Easter holidays taking groups of children to France.
sentences.cn: 她带领一群孩子去法国过复活节。

sentences.en: The poor guy obviously didn't have any place to go for Easter.
sentences.cn: 这个可怜的家伙显然复活节无处可去。

sentences.en: The soundtrack of "Highlander II" will be released on compact disc at Easter.
sentences.cn: 《挑战者2》的电影原声光盘将在复活节时发行。

sentences.en: The warehouse will hold more than 90,000 pallets storing 30 million Easter eggs.
sentences.cn: 那间仓库将用9万多个货盘装3,000万只复活节彩蛋。

sentences.en: The word Easter derives from Eostre, the pagan goddess of spring.
sentences.cn: Easter（复活节）一词由Eostre（多神教的春天女神）衍生而来。

sentences.en: They always go to church at Easter.
sentences.cn: 他们在复活节时总是去教堂.

sentences.en: We've spent our Easter holidays pleasantly.
sentences.cn: 我们的复活节假期过得很愉快.

phrases.tran_cn: （复活节人们用作礼物或装饰品的）复活节兔子；[美俚]令人仰慕的人
复活节岛（位于太平洋，属于智利）

trans.tran_en: a Christian holy day in March or April when Christians remember the death of Christ and his return to life
a Christian holy day in March or April when Christians remember the death of Christ and his return to life
